pull.title: doc: update documentation and scripts related to build directories
pull.body:
In [the other readmes](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/6ce50fd9d0ae6850d54bf883e7a7c1bcb6912c5c/src/test/README.md?plain=1#L19) we've provided a default build directory instead, unified the `developer-notes.md` to specify it explicitly.

In the next commit I've used this default to go over each reference to our binaries and changed their in-source references to the build directory.
Some of these changes were in example outputs - I haven't validated that the outputs are still the same.
Some of the changes were in utility scripts - I haven't tested them either.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/30741).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#29877](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29877) (tracing: explicitly cast block_connected duration to nanoseconds by 0xB10C)
* [#29553](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29553) (assumeutxo: Add dumptxoutset height param, remove shell scripts by fjahr)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

events.message:
Update documentation generation example in developer-notes.md

To correspond to the documentation style of e.g.  src/test/README.md

Co-authored-by: pablomartin4btc <pablomartin4btc@gmail.com>

scripted-diff: Prepend 'build/' to binary paths under 'src/'

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i -E 's!\./(src/bitcoin(d\b|[^.]))!./build/\1!g' $(git grep -l 'src/')
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

Change /src/ to /build/src/ in coverage script

Note that I wasn't able to test this locally, that's why it's in a separate commit

rename.from: Update documentation generation example in developer-notes.md
rename.to: cmake: update documentation generation example in developer-notes.md

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -338,9 +338,10 @@ Recommendations:
 
 ### Generating Documentation
 
-The documentation can be generated with `cmake --build <build_dir> --target docs`.
-The resulting files are located in `<build_dir>/doc/doxygen/html`; open
-`index.html` in that directory to view the homepage.
+Assuming the build directory is named `build`,
+the documentation can be generated with `cmake --build build --target docs`.
comments.body: Not sure that making this less generic is an improvement?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -338,9 +338,10 @@ Recommendations:
 
 ### Generating Documentation
 
-The documentation can be generated with `cmake --build <build_dir> --target docs`.
-The resulting files are located in `<build_dir>/doc/doxygen/html`; open
-`index.html` in that directory to view the homepage.
+Assuming the build directory is named `build`,
+the documentation can be generated with `cmake --build build --target docs`.
comments.body:
Seems to me that was the way we've proceded before: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/6ce50fd9d0ae6850d54bf883e7a7c1bcb6912c5c/src/test/README.md?plain=1#L19

And since we need to update the build directories in the docs (at least that's what I tried doing here), we need a sensible default.

Do you have a better suggestion?

comments.body:
Wont this break the usage as described in the readme:
```bash
BUILDDIR=$PWD/build ./contrib/devtools/gen-manpages.py 
/root/ci_scratch/build/build/src/bitcoind not found or not an executable
```

 ### Generating Documentation
 
-The documentation can be generated with `cmake --build <build_dir> --target docs`.
-The resulting files are located in `<build_dir>/doc/doxygen/html`; open
-`index.html` in that directory to view the homepage.
+Assuming the build directory is named `build`,

comments.body: Seems fine to leave this section as-is, because no update is required?

> To use this tool with out-of-tree builds set `BUILDDIR`.

Does this comment still apply?
Should I change it to `builddir = os.getenv('BUILDDIR', topdir)` to default to the build dir instead of modifying the `BINARIES` paths?
